text: I had some issue in VSCode when sending code (line or block) to the REPL, where the indentation increased by an additional tab each line.  Any known fix for this, or better way to send commands to the REPL from VSCode editor?

elements.text: I had some issue in VSCode when sending code (line or block) to the REPL, where the indentation increased by an additional tab each line.  Any known fix for this, or better way to send commands to the REPL from VSCode editor?

text: <@U01JRKTSL2U> I've encountered this once in Julia REPL outside of VSCode, so it might be some strange bug in the REPL. I was messing around a lot with strange unicode characters that day, so I brushed if off to that and just restarted the REPL. You you get that often?

text: I'd generally recommend using Alt-Enter to execute code, as that doesn't really involve the REPL much

text: The problem happened often, and I found a github issue in the REPL package.  If people don't know about it I proabably have a mis-configuration.

text: Sebastian, I had trouble configuring the terminal to accept commands from Alt-Enter.  can you point me to proper setup for julia repl?  I think I tried, but the VS Code default setup was julia v1.1 or something too old.
